info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 15 at 4:53AM PST until November 15 at 8:15AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Southeastern Santa Barbara County and southwestern Ventura County.
* WHEN...Until 815 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain developing over the southern California bight. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inch per hour are likely with locally higher amounts up to 1 inch per hour possible. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 5.1 inches of rain have fallen, so far. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Ventura, Santa Barbara, Camarillo, Ojai, Montecito, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Carpinteria, La Conchita, Summerland, Goleta, and El Rio. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM PST THIS MORNING
